org.josfranmc.gutenberg.catalog

Class CatalogDb

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.josfranmc.gutenberg.catalog.CatalogDb

  • public class CatalogDb
extends java.lang.Object
    It allows to load a collection of RdfFiles objects in a database.

    Each RdfFile object is inserted in a table called Books. If this table doesn't exist in the database, it is created.
    You may get a collection of RdfFiles objects from a CatalogRdf object.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Jose Francisco Mena Ceca
    See Also:
    CatalogRdf, RdfFile, Book

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()
        Loads the book catalog in a database. It takes the RdfFile objects collection that make up the catalog (collection previously assigned).
        It only loads new information. RDF files already loaded are ignored.
        See Also:
        RdfFile, Book

      • isBookInDatabase

        public boolean isBookInDatabase(java.lang.String id)
        Checks if a book already exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        id - book identify to check
        Returns:
        true if the book exists in database, false otherwise

      • getRdfCatalog

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,RdfFile> getRdfCatalog()
        Returns the RdfFile objects collection with which the object was initialized.
        Returns:
        a RdfFile objects collection
